title: RPC daemon subscription incosistent
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: git_branch=devel git_tag=v2021.10.03-1907-ga9bde213d-dirty
OS & Version: Linux
Commit hash : a9bde213d9537bdae31e2a4a7427acf45be8481d
Network: mainnet

Startup args:
```
--snap.stop --snapshots=true --authrpc.jwtsecret /etc/ethereum/jwt.hex --authrpc.port 8553 --datadir /erigon --http=false --maxpeers 20 --ethash.dagdir /erigon/erigon-ethash --port 30305 --trustedpeers=enode://xxx
```

Rpc daemon `"newBlockHeaders"` subscription is failing to report new blocks on arrival, falling behind the chain, and seems to report multiple blocks together with a delay.

I wrote a simple script that subscribes for `"newBlockHeaders"` on both geth and erigon and reports on arrival and here's the result:
```
18:01:36.554 GETH block 15590537
18:01:48.416 GETH block 15590538
18:01:48.988 ERIGON block: 15590537
18:01:48.988 ERIGON block: 15590538
18:02:00.751 GETH block 15590539
18:02:12.385 GETH block 15590540
18:02:12.895 ERIGON block: 15590539
18:02:12.896 ERIGON block: 15590540
18:02:25.161 GETH block 15590541
18:02:36.083 GETH block 15590542
18:02:36.595 ERIGON block: 15590541
18:02:36.597 ERIGON block: 15590542
18:02:48.382 GETH block 15590543
18:02:48.716 ERIGON block: 15590543
18:03:01.038 GETH block 15590544
18:03:01.492 ERIGON block: 15590544
18:03:13.263 GETH block 15590545
18:03:13.649 ERIGON block: 15590545
18:03:24.796 GETH block 15590546
18:03:36.721 GETH block 15590547
18:03:37.077 ERIGON block: 15590546
18:03:37.079 ERIGON block: 15590547
18:03:49.207 GETH block 15590548
18:04:01.241 GETH block 15590549
18:04:12.434 GETH block 15590550
18:04:13.200 ERIGON block: 15590548
18:04:13.200 ERIGON block: 15590549
18:04:13.201 ERIGON block: 15590550
18:04:24.971 GETH block 15590551
18:04:25.357 ERIGON block: 15590551
18:04:37.168 GETH block 15590552
18:04:37.513 ERIGON block: 15590552
18:04:49.041 GETH block 15590553
18:04:49.361 ERIGON block: 15590553
```

Also if I simply call `getBlockNumber()` on erigon, when a new block on geth arrives (while also giving erigon 1 extra second to catch up), erigon is very often 1-2 blocks behind

In erigon logs, I've noticed the RPC daemon is beeing notifdied very often about the same block or about multiple blocks.
```

can you try this branch out `flushing-blocks`

> can you try this branch out `flushing-blocks`

Unfortunately no, since when I update https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/5482 reoccurs and erigon is not working
I want to see the rpc notification. If the rpc is being notified of the same block multiple times still.

> times

Looks like sometimes it does, although less than before, and some commit times have gone up quite a bit
```
